#Text=Oskar van Deventer
#Text=Gear cube
#Text=Oskar van Deventer is a Dutch puzzle maker . [ 1 ]
#Text=He prototypes puzzles using 3D printing .
#Text=His work combines mathematics , physics , and design , and he collaborates at academic institutions . [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ]
#Text=Many of his combination puzzles are in mass production by Uwe Mèffert and WitEden .
#Text=Oskar van Deventer has also designed puzzles for Hanayama .
#Text=He was a Guinness World Record holder for his 17×17×17 " Over the Top Cube " Rubik 's cube -style puzzle from 2012 to 2016 , [ 5 ] [ 6 ] when it was beaten by a 22×22×22 cube . [ 7 ]

column1: #Text=In addition to being a puzzle maker , Oskar is a research scientist in the area of media networking and holds a Ph.D. in optics .
#Text=He has over 100 publications , over 80 patents applications , and hundreds of standardization contributions . [ 8 ]
#Text=Mass produced puzzles
#Text=Gear cube : Previously named " Caution Cube " because there was a big chance to pinch your fingers with the gears . [ 9 ]

column1: #Text=It was mass-produced by Mèffert 's in 2010 , [ 10 ] but over time it appeared as several copies and shape mods of the same design .
#Text=Gear Cube Extreme : A bandaged version of the Gear cube , where 4 gears are replaced with 4 standard edges , making the puzzle harder .
#Text=It was mass-produced by Mèffert 's in 2010 , [ 11 ] and was also copied by other companies .
#Text=Gear Shift : It was mass-produced by Mèffert 's in 2011 ; [ 12 ]
#Text=a knock off version also appeared .
#Text=David Gear Cube : Previously called " Polo cube " in reference to Alex Polonsky , who had the idea . [ 13 ]
#Text=It was mass-produced By Mèffert 's in 2013 . [ 14 ]
#Text=Geared Mixup : A variant of the gear cube where all faces can perform 90 °rotations , allowing centers to be interchanged with edges , hence the term " mixup " .
#Text=It was mass-produced by Mèffert 's in 2014 . [ 15 ]
#Text=Geared 5×5×5 : An unknown Chinese company mass-produced this puzzle in 2015 using a 3D printed sample , without the permission of Oskar .
#Text=An agreement was met to please both sides . [ 16 ]
#Text=Gear Ball : A mass-produced spherical Gear cube made by Mèffert 's . [ 17 ]
#Text=Mosaic cube : Previously called " Fadi cube " , it is a corner turning puzzle with two cut depths similar to Okamoto and Greg 's " Lattice Cube " .
#Text=It was mass-produced by Mèffert 's in 2010 . [ 18 ]
#Text=Planets puzzle : Four balls in a frame .
#Text=Craters on the balls block and unblock movement on the adjacent balls .
#Text=Rob 's Pyraminx : It was mass-produced by Mèffert 's in 2014 . [ 19 ]
#Text=Rob 's Octahedron : It was mass-produced by Mèffert 's in 2015 . [ 20 ]
#Text=Mixup Cube : a 3×3×3 Rubik 's cube that can perform 45 °rotations on the middle layers , allowing centers interchange with edges .
#Text=It was mass-produced by WitEden . [ 21 ]
#Text=Treasure chest : A 3×3×3 puzzle that when solved , can be opened , revealing a small chamber inside .
#Text=It was mass-produced by Mèffert 's . [ 22 ]
#Text=Icosaix : A face turning icosahedron with jumbling movements .
#Text=It was mass-produced by MF8 in 2015 . [ 23 ]
#Text=Crazy Comet : Was mass-produced by LanLan without Oskar 's permission in 2016 but a deal was archived later . [ 24 ]
#Text=Redi Cube : A corner turning puzzle mass produced by Moyu in 2017 . [ 25 ]
